metadata.synopsis: Tom (Ashton Kutcher) and Sarah (Brittany Murphy) are two lovebirds from different worlds. He's an average guy with a fondness for beer who works a low-level job, while she's an aspiring writer from a wealthy and cultured family. The disapproval of family and friends doesn't prevent the pair from marrying, but their disastrous honeymoon in Italy, with an unwelcome appearance by Sarah's ex-boyfriend, Peter (Christian Kane), nearly succeeds in tearing them apart.

reviews: [A] strained, forced, uncomfortable and unfunny attempt at comedy.
a bizarre mixture of original comedy with fresh delivery and painfully old gags
Immature and annoying; the jokes are tired.
The outside seat-fillers at the screening happily ate up every unsurprising, unfunny second, but that doesn't mean that you have to.
Besides the sub-par script the problem is that Kutcher and Murphy have zero chemistry.
...it's the paper-thin characters and utterly predictable storyline that does the film in.
...nails the lowest possible IQ in the audience by being as insipid as it is boring.
Depois de bombardear o mundo com o pssimo Sonho de Campeo, o roteirista Sam Harper levou dez anos at conseguir ver este seu novo trabalho chegar s telonas. Ele deveria ter esperado mais vinte anos.
Murphy has no comic timing and Kutcher overcompensates.
[Murphy] shouldn't have chosen Just Married, with its irritating script and banal premise, as her first romantic comedy to topline.
Move over Britney Spears and all other aspiring Britney wannabees. There's a new Britney in town and her name is Brittany Murphy. .
In watching the harried antics of a blustery mismatched married couple in the disjointed Just Married, is there anyway we can get our 95 minutes annulled from this marital mockery?

No es de esas pelculas que se vayan a recordar durante mucho tiempo, pero logra su propsito de entretener durante poco ms de 90 minutos, a pesar de lo simplista que pudiera parecer su historia en una primera impresin.

... as the laughter suddenly stops... the guys in the audience will look at each other helplessly and think Did they switch out the last reel or did I walk into the wrong movie on my way back from the bathroom?

Well, here's the first official mainstream release of 2003, and if the quality of the first movie of the year is inversely proportionate to the overall quality of the year as a whole, we're off to a good start.
